result.execSummary:
The defendant Derak AZ Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to  3 1/2  years Imprisonment, consisting of 18 months Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH, to be served concurrent to any sentences in being.
Concurrent with: any sentences in being.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derak AZ Schultz

defendant.name: Schultz, Derak AZ
defendant.address: 537 State Farm Rd Lot 16, Deerfield, WI 53531

records.addlTxt: Transcript from 9/26/2022 plea and sentencing hearing (prison)

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 2:10pm
Defendant Derak AZ Schultz in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court for Derak AZ Schultz.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "  NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Remaining Counts

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to  3 1/2  years Imprisonment, consisting of 18 months Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH, to be served concurrent to any sentences in being. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives   90  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--complete Certified Batterers Intervention programming
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no contact with Victim 1, unless approved by DOC and by Victim 1
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol or non prescribed controlled substances
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, to include $76 in subpoena fees


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 2:27pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Stipulation for Setting of Plea and Sentencing Hearing
State's Notice of Intent to Admit Certified Medical Records

Final status/scheduling conference on October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on October 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
made by Defense on this date

[ma] Case called at 8:33am 
Defendant Derak AZ Schultz in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court for Derak AZ Schultz.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Officer Brett Dunkelburger -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by DA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Luchsinger


The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Schultz committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--Defense demands speedy trial
recess: 8:50am  

NEXT:  (1) FSSC on 10/11/22 at 9:30am  (2) Jury Trial on 10/17/22 at 8:15am (speedy demand)
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 1:40pm 
Defendant Derak AZ Schultz appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Mr. Schultz verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $250 Cash Bond with conditions:
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence
--no contact with the Victim
--no presence at the Victim's residence 
recess 1:47pm. 

NEXT:   Preliminary Hearing on July 29th at 8:30am   [Mr. Schultz is currently on a PO Hold in the Jefferson County Jail]
